com.konakart.mqif

Interface MqMgrIf

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MqMgr, RabbitMqMgrEE

    public interface MqMgrIf
    MqMgrIf - Message Queue Manager Interface Interface which an implementation of this manager must adhere to.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkAPIAccessSupported(java.lang.String apiName, MqOptionsIf options)
      Check that the MQOptions parameters are supported through the specified KKEngIf API
      void commit(MqOptionsIf options)
      Commit all the messages read by the message reader (typically after successful processing).
      void delayMessage(MqOptionsIf options)
      Re-post the message with a delay (typically after unsuccessful processing).
      MqResponseIf listMessagesOnQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
      Creates a string containing a list of the messages on the specified queue
      void postMessageToQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
      Post a message to a specified queue.
      void purgeQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
      Purge all messages from a specified queue.
      MqResponseIf readMessageFromQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
      Read a single message from a specified queue.
      void removeReader(MqOptionsIf options)
      Remove the message reader if it exists.

    • Method Detail

      • postMessageToQueue

        void postMessageToQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
                 throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Post a message to a specified queue. Use the options parameter to define the message text, credentials and the destination queue.
        Parameters:
        options - the MQ options
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • readMessageFromQueue

        MqResponseIf readMessageFromQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
                           throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Read a single message from a specified queue. Use the options parameter to define credentials, a timeout value and the name of the queue to read.
        Parameters:
        options - the MQ options
        Returns:
        an object describing the response from this call. Usually it will contain the text of the message that was read, but if there was a timeout the message will be null and the timedout attribute will be true.
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • listMessagesOnQueue

        MqResponseIf listMessagesOnQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
                          throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Creates a string containing a list of the messages on the specified queue
        Parameters:
        options - the MQ options
        Returns:
        an object describing the response from this call. Usually it will contain a list of the messages on the specified queue, but if there was a timeout the message will be null and the timedout attribute will be true.
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • purgeQueue

        void purgeQueue(MqOptionsIf options)
         throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Purge all messages from a specified queue. Use the options parameter to define credentials, a timeout value and the name of the queue to read.
        Parameters:
        options - the MQ options
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • delayMessage

        void delayMessage(MqOptionsIf options)
           throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Re-post the message with a delay (typically after unsuccessful processing). The original message is removed from the queue with a commit.
        Parameters:
        options - the MqOptions object - set the brokerURL, the username, the Queue name, the messageId and the mode.
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • commit

        void commit(MqOptionsIf options)
     throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Commit all the messages read by the message reader (typically after successful processing).
        Parameters:
        options - the MqOptions object - set the brokerURL, the username, the Queue name, the messageId and the mode.
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • removeReader

        void removeReader(MqOptionsIf options)
           throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Remove the message reader if it exists.
        Parameters:
        options - the MqOptions object - set the brokerURL, the username, the Queue, name the messageId and the mode.
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • checkAPIAccessSupported

        void checkAPIAccessSupported(java.lang.String apiName,
                             MqOptionsIf options)
                      throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Check that the MQOptions parameters are supported through the specified KKEngIf API
        Parameters:
        apiName - the name of the API called
        options - the MQ Options
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException - if the specified MQ Options are not supported for this API call
